testcase.brief: When neighbor AP is under backhaul mode, check if BG scan can find it
testcase.description: Pre-Condition: Test Procedure: 1.enable bgscan on wifi0 2.put 2 bx in screen room (box under backhaul mode) 3.set scan interval to 1 minute 4.set wifi0/wifi1 power and channel to fixed value 5.reboot box 6.check if box can find all neighbors in screen room

step.desc: configure ap1 wifi0, set bgscan interval to 1 and enable bgscan client
step.console: -v "ssid ${ssid.name}1" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${ssid.name}1" -v "radio profile ng" -v "radio profile ng phymode 11ng" -v "radio profile ng scan access interval 1" -v "interface wifi0 radio profile ng" -v "interface wifi0 radio channel 6" -v "save config"

step.desc: configure ap1 wifi1, set bgscan interval to 1 and enable bgscan client
step.console: -v "radio profile na" -v "radio profile na phymode 11na" -v "radio profile na scan access interval 1" -v "interface wifi1 radio profile na" -v "interface wifi1 radio channel 165" -v "save config"

step.desc: configure ap2, set wifi0 mode to backhaul
step.console: -v "interface wifi0 mode backhaul" -v "radio profile ng" -v "radio profile ng phymode 11ng" -v "interface wifi0 radio profile ng" -v "interface wifi0 radio channel 6" -v "save config"

step.desc: configure ap2, set wifi0 mode to backhaul
step.console: -v "ssid ${ssid.name}2" -v "interface wifi1 ssid ${ssid.name}2" -v "radio profile na" -v "radio profile na phymode 11na" -v "radio profile na channel-width 40-below" -v "interface wifi1 radio profile na" -v "interface wifi1 radio channel 153" -v "save config"

step.desc: check the AP2 interface wifi0.1 of MAC
get the AP2 interface wifi0.1 of MAC
check the AP2 interface wifi1.1 of MAC
get the AP2 interface wifi1.1 of MAC
check the AP2 interface wifi1.2 of MAC
get the AP2 interface wifi1.2 of MAC
5.wait about 4 minute,check if AP1 can find all neighbors related to AP2
